titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 35

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 13 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 35; Qurʾānic Text: Q 8:72-8:75, Q 9:5-9:11, Q 9:18-9:24, Q 9:32-9:33; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 235 x 163mm; Script style: kūfi D.III.
The fragment Arabe 356 (a) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 35
13 л. 163×235 mm (1.44). Support: thin and transparent parchment of yellowish color, with traces of polishing. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: fragments of three quires.
I: H1F H2F H3F / S F4H F5H;
II: H6F H7F S / F8H F9H F10H;
III: H11F S / F12H F13H;

Text layout: 67×150 mm (2.24), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: occasional diagonal dashes in brown or red color, probably a later addition. Vocalization: red, green and yellow dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold and colors; for groups of five verses – medallions on the margins (type 4.A.II) in gold and colors with the inscribed word خمس, accompanied in the line with the letter ﻪ (hā) in gold marking the actual border of the verse; for groups of ten verses – medallions on the margins (type 3.B.II) in gold and colors with the inscribed number of the verse (عشر – fol. 7v, عشرون – fol. 10v).
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs and verses are inscribed in Roman and Arabic numerals on the upper margins; catchwords on fol. 6–13 (probably, in J.-J. Marcel’s hand).

Defects: minor stains and traces of moisture; margins damaged probably by rodents, especially on fol. 1–2; parchment destruction caused by aggressive ink, especially on fol. 12; ink has partly peeled off on some of the pages.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with letters “B”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “. VIII v. 73 a 76 \\ S. IX v. 5 ? A 10, 18 a 24, et ? 32” and old accession number in red pencil “В 13.
Old accession numbers: В (on the wrapping); B. 13 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–3v Surah 8, verses 73(72) – 76(75). Incipit: [لم يهاجرو]ا ما لكم من ولايتهم . Explicit: وأولوا الأ[رحام] .
Fol. 4r–7v. Surah 9, verses 5(5) – 11(11). Incipit: [أقاموا الصلا]ة وآتوا الزكاة. Explicit: تابوا وأقا[موا الصلاة] .
Fol. 8r–12v. Surah 9, verses 18(18)–24(24). Incipit: [يعمر مسا]جد الله من آمن. Explicit: اقترفتموها [وتجارةٌ] .
Fol. 13r–13v. Surah 9, verses 32(32)–33(33). Incipit: يريدو[ن أن يطفئوا]. Explicit: على الدين كلّه [ولَوْ كره] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Arabe 356a (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
